items.text: Dann was born in [[LINK|lang_en|Burnaby|Burnaby]], [[LINK|lang_en|British_Columbia|British Columbia]]. He played the violin until 1970, when he switched to the viola. He began studying with [[LINK|lang_en|Lorand_Fenyves|Lorand Fenyves]] in [[LINK|lang_en|Toronto|Toronto]] in 1972, and continued his studies until he graduated from the [[LINK|lang_en|University_of_Toronto|University of Toronto]] in 1977. During this time, he also studied with [[LINK|lang_en|Robert_Pikler|Robert Pikler]] in [[LINK|lang_en|Australia|Australia]], as well as [[LINK|lang_en|William_Primrose|William Primrose]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Bruno_Giuranna|Bruno Giuranna]].

Dann has held the position of principal viola with a number of orchestras, including the [[LINK|lang_en|National_Arts_Centre_Orchestra|National Arts Centre Orchestra]], the [[LINK|lang_en|Royal_Concertgebouw_Orchestra|Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra]] in [[LINK|lang_en|Amsterdam|Amsterdam]], the [[LINK|lang_en|Vancouver_Symphony_Orchestra|Vancouver Symphony Orchestra]], and the [[LINK|lang_en|Toronto_Symphony_Orchestra|Toronto Symphony Orchestra]].

As soloist, Dann has performed concerti with several orchestras, as well as with conductors [[LINK|lang_en|Vladimir_Ashkenazy|Vladimir Ashkenazy]], Sir [[LINK|lang_en|John_Eliot_Gardiner|John Eliot Gardiner]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Andrew_Davis_(conductor)|Andrew Davis]]. He has also commissioned concerti and chamber works from a number of composers, notably [[LINK|lang_en|Alexina_Louie|Alexina Louie]], [[LINK|lang_en|Christos_Hatzis|Christos Hatzis]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Kaija_Saariaho|Kaija Saariaho]]. He is a noted chamber musician as well as a member of the Axelrod Quartet and the Smithsonian Chamber Players, both based in [[LINK|lang_en|Washington,_D.C.|Washington, D.C.]]
